update e_machin_set

update e_machin_set set dic_mac_type = #{dicMacType,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, dic_tea_attr = #{dicTeaAttr,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, dic_mac_pro = #{dicMacPro,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, dic_roll_type = #{dicRollType,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, temperature = #{temperature,jdbcType=INTEGER}, humidity = #{humidity,jdbcType=INTEGER}, mac_loss = #{macLoss,jdbcType=INTEGER}, begin_duration = #{beginDuration,jdbcType=INTEGER}, end_duration = #{endDuration,jdbcType=INTEGER}, duration_type = #{durationType,jdbcType=INTEGER}, status = #{status,jdbcType=INTEGER}, description = #{description,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, roll_status = #{rollStatus,jdbcType=INTEGER}, create_id = #{createId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, create_time = #{createTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP}, modify_id = #{modifyId,jdbcType=VARCHAR}, modify_time = #{modifyTime,jdbcType=TIMESTAMP} where id = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
mapper.select: SELECT m.id, m.dic_mac_type dicMacType, m.dic_tea_attr dicTeaAttr,m.description, m.dic_mac_pro dicMacPro,m.status, m.temperature, m.humidity, m.mac_loss, m.begin_duration, m.end_duration, m.duration_type, m.create_time,m.roll_status,d.value dicMacValue, d.name dicMacName FROM e_machin_set m LEFT JOIN s_dictionary d ON m.dic_mac_pro = d.id WHERE 1 = 1 AND m.id = #{id}
select count(id) from e_machin_set where dic_tea_attr = #{id,jdbcType=VARCHAR}
